steps.title: Assemble all the items needed for preparing your nails.
steps.content: Assemble all the items needed for preparing your nails. These are listed below under "Things You'll Need."

steps.title: Wash your hands with mild soap before painting your nails.
steps.content: Wash your hands with mild soap before painting your nails. This will wash off any germs or bacteria on your hands and nails while also cleaning off any dirt.

steps.title: Apply a solid basecoat to protect your nails.
steps.content: Apply a solid basecoat to protect your nails. This is optional, but it makes the color show up better and protects it. Make sure to let it dry thoroughly. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Paint your nails
steps.content: Paint your nails in a light grey, nude, or light pink nail polish color. Let it dry thoroughly before doing the next step. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pour a bit of rubbing alcohol or water into the cap or into a small jar.
steps.content: Pour a bit of rubbing alcohol or water into the cap or into a small jar.

steps.title: Dip each nail into the rubbing alcohol for about 5 seconds each.
steps.content: Dip each nail into the rubbing alcohol for about 5 seconds each. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Take a small piece of newspaper.
steps.content: Take a small piece of newspaper . Press it firmly on your nail for a few seconds. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Peel it off carefully.
steps.content: Peel it off carefully. You'll find that the ink from the newspaper will be left behind.

steps.title: Get a cotton bud and some nail polish remover to remove any excess nail polish that has gotten onto your fingers.
steps.content: Get a cotton bud and some nail polish remover to remove any excess nail polish that has gotten onto your fingers. Do not touch your nails with the nail polish remover, or your work will come off. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Apply a topcoat to your nails.
steps.content: Apply a topcoat to your nails. This is needed because without it, the newspaper will rub off. It also gives your nail some extra shine. Enjoy! [6] X Research source If you want your nails to be long and healthy, avoid putting stress on your nails. It can lead to breakage. Do not damage your nails by picking off gel polish instead of properly soaking it. Invest in nail care products. For example, Sally Hansen's Vitamin E Nail & Cuticle Oil helps hydrate cuticles and nails. It helps to strengthen them and repair any damage.
